intro: Campylandra wattii, commonly known as the Watt's campylandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes various bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
